sub_title: Project Lead at Unknown & MSc Innovation Engineer || Sustainable Entrepreneurship | Impact Tech | Human-Centred Design |
summary:
My mission is to accelerate sustainable innovations to fight climate change and create a better tomorrow. Lets embark on a journey into the unknown! 
____________________________________________________________________________________________________________

I lead open innovation projects with international clients and governmental institutions to fuel founders to scale their impactful technologies. 

My engineering background have given me skills in innovation processes, sustainable product development and human-centred design. 
_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________

I am passionate about accelerating impactful technologies and circular solutions that encourage regenerative resource systems, sustainable consumption patterns and collaborative value chains. 
I believe bold systemic innovation is needed to transform our current conservative societal and industrial systems. 

Scaling green technologies, cross-sectoral partnerships and green business models are vital ingredients to the future I want to create.

projects.title: Designing a Circular Paint Experience (Master Thesis)
projects.description:
Master thesis (graduation) project on Circular Economy in collaboration with the paint manufacture PPG and support from TU Delft.  

Industrial activities have led to over-exploitation of natural resources and environmental degradation, which inevitably will lead to severe and irreversible changes for people, economies and ecosystems around the world. To mitigate this global challenge, there is an urgent need for solutions that lower CO2 emissions and protect natural resources. A solution lies in circular economy and circular design to solving some of these challenges, particularly in the paint industry.

The overall goal of this project was to obtain knowledge on circular economy and circular design and apply this to discover and explore circular solutions within the paint manufacturer PPG. To this end, the following problem statement was developed and applied throughout the project:
"How can we support PPG in extending their producer responsibility and assist DIY customers in reducing their paint waste?"
In response to the problem statement, the project developed the solution ”No paint wasted”. The solution aims at the top of the circular waste hierarchy, reducing the environmental impact from unused paint currently ending up in storage, incineration or in polluting water. The solution consists of three components which aids do-it-yourself paint customers.

The three components consists of: a planning app that provides accurate guidance; unit sizes that change product offerings to support the purchase of correct amounts; a cleaning kit to support correct cleaning practices with equipment and enable recycling of paint packaging. The combined solution, results in a reduction of paint waste.

The outcome of this project has provided PPG with inspiration to reconsider their current linear business model and see the potential in business opportunities that decouple value creation from resource consumption.

projects.title: Green Challenge DTU 2019 (Grøn Dyst) - Plan2Plate
projects.description:
Participated in the annual university Green Challenge with the sustainable food project "Plan2Plate - Sustainable meals made easy" that supports consumers to make sustainable food choices. 

Food consumptions accounts for 25% of a person's total carbon footprint which is twice as much as a car on average. Changing your car to a more sustainable model usually involves a big investment, while changing your food habits does not. Main barriers are lack of knowledge, lack of inspiration and the assumption that eating climate friendly is too expensive and time consuming.

Plan2Plate is an app solution that combines inspirational sustainable meals with low CO2 footprint with a simple and flexible planning system to decrease shopping time and frequency. Plan2Plate tracks the progress of the user and calculates the CO2 footprint of the planned meals. Additionally, it provides tips and guides on how to make sustainable food choices. The users can create meal plans from the recipe library or upload their own favourite recipes to be assessed and included in their meal plan. Either way, Plan2Plates helps users plan their sustainable food choices one plate at a time.

contributors.headline: Project Lead at Unknown & MSc Innovation Engineer || Sustainable Entrepreneurship | Impact Tech | Human-Centred Design |

projects.title: Environmental Product Development of Packaging (Bachelor Thesis Project)
projects.description:
Through research on the environmental issues of plastic packaging we have made a product analysis and environmental profile for the life cycle of packaging. In addition to this we have created a specification of user need, though interviews with various relevant actors within the network of packaging in Denmark. Through a creative problem solving process, we have walked through many ideas and come up with a final concept through function evaluation and prototyping sessions with users.    

Using the product will have follow positive environmental effect: 
- The longer a packaging is reused the less impact the plastic has on the environment because the production effects are distributed over longer time. 
- Food waste will be lowered. 
- External plastic components will not be necessary. 
The exact reduced environmental effect will be presented in the pitch. 

We can conclude that by prolonging packaging and it’s contents lifespan the environmental impacts are reduced.

profile_positions.title: Project Lead

profile_positions.description:
Working as an independent task manager on the EIT funded Circular Cities project on mapping and disseminating Circular Economy solutions in municipal practises.  

Tasks and achievements:
•	Project management: tracked and supported deliverables and KPIs
•	Partner management: worked closely with the City of Malmö, Copenhagen and Helsinki, C40, Veolia and Cleantech Bulgaria. 
•	Project execution: hosted external webinar program across Europe for start-ups; a final project 
 conference, workshop and consortium kick-down meeting. (Available online via link below). 
•	Project reporting: leading and coordinating with lead partner the City of Malmö
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Supporting projects addressing circular economy, open innovation and urban transition. 
Tasks and achievements:
•	Project management: reviewed and edited published white papers and reporting
•	Business development: co-developed proposals and conducted editorial review 
•	Research: compiled a climate strategy analysis for Nordic cities 
•	Project execution: development of a CE game for Word Circular Economy Forum 

About: Climate KIC is supported by the European Institute of Innovation and Technology to identify and support innovation that helps society mitigate and adapt to climate change. We believe that a decarbonised, sustainable economy is not only necessary to prevent catastrophic climate change, but presents a wealth of opportunities for business and society.
